workflow.name: Analyze competitor content gaps with Gemini AI, Apify & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

## Capture More Traffic: AI-Mapped Topics & Keywords
Stay ahead of competitors by uncovering their content strategies automatically. This workflow crawls competitor websites, extracts structured topic hierarchies, entities, and depth scores, and delivers actionable insights directly into Google Sheets. No more manual browsing, just clean, analyzable data you can act on.

## Benefits
- **Competitor mapping at scale**  Automatically map sites into hierarchical topics and entities.
- **Data-driven content strategy**  Identify gaps, weak spots, and opportunities to stand out.
- **Seamless integration**  Results flow straight into Google Sheets for filtering, charting, or export.
- **Time & resource savings**  Eliminate copy-paste research and focus on strategy.

## Target audience
- SEO specialists and digital marketers
- Content strategists and copywriters
- Agencies running content audits
- SaaS startups monitoring competition
- E-commerce teams benchmarking rivals

## Required APIs
- Google Sheets credentials (trigger & save)
- Apify API token (crawler)
- Gemini (Google Generative AI) key (content parsing)

## Easy customization
- **Competitor domains:** Update in the Google Sheets config.
- **Crawl depth & limits:** Adjust `max_pages_num` and `crawl_depth_num`.
- **Output format:** Modify the Code node to add or remove Google Sheets columns.
- **Delivery channels:** Add Slack or Email nodes for instant audit reports.

workflow.name: Competitor Content Gap Analyzer: Automated Website Topic Mapping

parameters.text:
=You are a competitive content analyst.
Analyze the competitor website page provided in `markdown`.

Return ONLY valid JSON matching this schema:

{
  "page_url": "string",
  "title": "string",
  "content_type": "string",
  "main_topics": [
    {
      "topic": "string",
      "level": "number (must start at 1 for top-level)",
      "subtopics": [
        {
          "topic": "string",
          "level": "number (increment by 1 for each deeper heading)",
          "subtopics": []
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "key_entities": ["string"],
  "depth_score_1_to_5": "number"
}

Rules:
- Strict JSON output. No extra text, no explanations.
- content_type: choose from ["landing","blog","service","about"].
- "main_topics" must always start at level 1.
- Subtopics increment level by +1 relative to their parent.
- If no subtopics, return [].
- Always close JSON properly.

Content to analyze:
{{ $json["markdown"] }}

parameters.content:
## Competitor Content Gap Analyzer: Automated Website Topic Mapping
Stay ahead of competitors by uncovering their content strategies automatically. This workflow crawls competitor websites, extracts structured topic hierarchies, entities, and depth scores, and delivers actionable insights directly into Google Sheets‚Äîno more manual browsing, just clean, analyzable data you can act on.

parameters.customBody:
={{ JSON.stringify({
  crawlerType: "cheerio",
  startUrls: $json.startUrls,                 
  useSitemaps: false,
  maxDepth: $json.crawl_depth_num  || 0,
  maxRequestsPerCrawl: $json.max_pages_num || 20,
maxConcurrency:1,
  respectRobotsTxtFile: true,
  ignoreHttpsErrors: true,
  proxyConfiguration: { useApifyProxy: true },
  removeCookieWarnings: true,
  removeElementsCssSelector: "nav, footer, script, style, noscript, svg, img[src^='data:']",
  blockMedia: true,
  saveMarkdown: true,
  saveHtml: false,
  saveFiles: false,
  saveScreenshots: false
}) }}

parameters.message:
=

üìä Competitor SEO Content Analysis Report

Page URL: {{ $json.page_url }}

Main Topics

{{ $json.main_topics }}

Keywords Identified

{{ $json.key_words }}
parameters.subject: =SEO Audit Report: {{ $json.page_url }}

parameters.content:
### Save Data Of The request
Append sheet.
Use **Google Sheets OAuth2** credential

### Crawl Competitor Website
Run apify/website-content-crawler with startUrls; saveMarkdown: true.
Credentials: Use **Apify API** credential.

### Analyze Page Send markdown; expect strict JSON back.
Credentials:  
Use **Google Gemini/PaLM** credential.

### Send report 
Send Email
Credentials: Use **Gmail OAuth2** credential. (required).

## Benefits
- **Competitor mapping at scale**  Automatically map sites into hierarchical topics and entities.
- **Data-driven content strategy**  Identify gaps, weak spots, and opportunities to stand out.
- **Seamless integration**  Results flow straight into Google Sheets for filtering, charting, or export.
- **Time & resource savings**  Eliminate copy-paste research and focus on strategy.

## Target audience
- SEO specialists and digital marketers
- Content strategists and copywriters
- Agencies running content audits
- SaaS startups monitoring competition
- E-commerce teams benchmarking rivals

## Required APIs
- Google Sheets credentials (trigger & save)
- Apify API token (crawler)
- Gemini (Google Generative AI) key (content parsing)
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials (send report emails)

## Easy customization
- **Competitor domains:** Update in the Google Sheets config.
- **Crawl depth & limits:** Adjust `max_pages_num` and `crawl_depth_num`.
- **Output format:** Modify the Code node to add or remove Google Sheets columns.
- **Delivery channels:** Add Slack or Email nodes for instant audit reports.

### Create sheet for the data
Credentials:
Use **Google Sheets OAuth2** credential.

### Webhook ‚Äî Start Here

**Production URL**
Copy the **Production** URL from the Webhook node and share it with your form/app.

### Submission form
**POST (required)**
- `competitor` (domain or URL; aliases: `competitors`, `url`)
- `notify_email` (recipient; alias: `email`)

**Optional**
- `include_paths` (e.g. `/blog/`, `/services/*`)
- `exclude_paths` (e.g. `/login`, `/wp-admin/*`)
- `max_pages` (default 20)
- `crawl_depth` (default 1)

**Webhook URL**
Set `webhookUrl` to your n8n endpoint (e.g. `https://<host>/webhook/competitors`).se '/webhook-test/competitors'

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
